page.title: 04BAYSTON HILL FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: The club was first formed in 1923.It ceased to exist in 1930 but was reformed in 1960.The team play on a field near Lythwood Hall owned by the parish council.The football strip is supplied by sponsors but nets,flags,line markers and footballs are purchased by the club from funds.There are two team squads. Each one has 18 players.There is a pavillion being built at the moment with changing rooms for players.They play in the west Shropshire Alliance and play teams as far away as Weston Rhyn in Wales.They won the league in 1977and 1979, the league cup in 1979,and in 1984 the Shropshire Junior cup.Players can sign on at 15.Referees are supplied for home matches by a referees panel in Shrewsbury.
